channel.title: bash on Development Cheat Sheets
channel.description: Recent content in bash on Development Cheat Sheets

item.title: Configuration (Linux)
item.description: This page provides information about how to configure linux.

item.title: Files
item.description: File and file permissions are core to the security model used by Linux systems.

item.title: sh - Shell Command Language
item.description: sh (or the Shell Command Language) is a programming language described by the POSIX standard. It has many implementations (ksh88, dash, …). bash can also be considered an implementation of sh.

item.title: ssh - Secure Shell Protocol
item.description: The Secure Shell Protocol (SSH) is a cryptographic network protocol for operating network services securely over an unsecured network. Its most notable applications are remote login and command-line execution
